definition: to rise/to fly upward
to fly
abbr. for 揚州|扬州[Yang2 zhou1]/surname Yang
to raise/to hoist/the action of tossing or winnowing/scattering (in the wind)/to flutter/to propagate
variant of 揚|扬[yang2]
in high spirits (idiom); glowing with health and vigor
bossy and domineering/throwing one's weight about

sentences.english: Firecrackers exploded, flags flew high, and cars honked wildly.
sentences.chinese: 炮声阵阵，旗帜飞扬，就连汽车的喇叭都摁得朝天响。

sentences.english: The white gauze or in memory of the flying.
sentences.chinese: 心里的白色纱裙还是记忆中飞扬的样子。

sentences.english: Recognize a feeling in the rain fly, a curtain of dreams around my breathing.
sentences.chinese: 认一脉情思在雨中飞扬，认一帘绮梦缠绕着心的呼吸。

sentences.english: Your laughter flying in the arena, winning glory for the number of classes you best.
sentences.chinese: 你的欢笑飞扬在赛场，为班争光数你最棒。

sentences.english: That winter is flying the wisdom.
sentences.chinese: 那年的冬天是飞扬的般若。

sentences.english: Gheryan town liberated green flags flying in all top destinations.
sentences.chinese: 盖尔扬解放，高处绿旗飞扬。

sentences.english: The truck kicked a cloud of dust up.
sentences.chinese: 阵雨涤荡了空中飞扬的灰尘。

sentences.english: I have to come out a blue, cloud son inside the four seas float in the sky, the brave mans lock tightly everywhere.
sentences.chinese: 我必须走出蓝色，四海内云儿飞扬，猛士们紧锁四方。

sentences.english: The graceful-danced con, plete fountain consists of many group of nozzles.
sentences.chinese: 轻舞飞扬成组喷泉是由很多组喷头组合而成的。

sentences.english: Closed system, negative pressure operation, no dust emissions, a good operating environment.
sentences.chinese: 系统全封闭，微负压操作，无粉尘飞扬，操作环境好。

sentences.english: People live this time, should live arrogant.
sentences.chinese: 人就活这一次，理应活的飞扬跋扈。

sentences.english: Today blowing sand dusts the town and silts its harbor.
sentences.chinese: 如今，飞扬的沙尘弥漫了小镇，掩盖了港口。

sentences.english: A gale has risen and is sweeping the clouds across the sky.
Two of our rarest, and most graceful, butterflies are on the wing this weekend.
sentences.chinese: 本周末有两个稀有而最优雅的蝴蝶在展翅飞扬。

sentences.english: The colour of the road had changed from sand colour to more reddish but the dust was still present.
sentences.chinese: 路面从沙色变得略红，但是依然尘土飞扬。

sentences.english: C. It's a spacious and silent road, and you can make your thoughts whirl around.
sentences.chinese: 空旷的大道上寂静无声，任你思绪飞扬。

definition: wind-borne/tossed about by the wind
to fly up/to dance in the air (of snowflakes, flower petals etc)
to flutter/to dance in the breeze
lit. to fill the whole sky/everywhere/as far as the eye can see
to swirl in the air (of thickly falling snowflakes, flower petals etc)/to flutter about
in the wind/facing the wind/downwind
suave/graceful/fluent and elegant (calligraphy)
to float about/to flutter (in the breeze)/(dialect) gay guy/(Tw) ghost
whole sky
to float/to drift
to wave/to flutter/to fly
gale/squall/whole gale (meteorology)
to raise one's head/to perk up
soughing/whistling or rushing sound (of the wind in trees, the sea etc)
to move as in a dance/to wave (some implement)/to flourish/(of eyes, hands etc) to dance/to flutter
dust
